section.class: elementor-element elementor-element-db11b1e elementor-section-full_width elementor-section-height-min-height elementor-section-items-bottom elementor-section-height-default elementor-section elementor-top-section

div.h1: IDEA Areas of Need during COVID-19

div.div: Given the evolving number of COVID-19 cases across the country, IDEA Public Schools is focused on the safety of our students, staff and communities.

section.class: elementor-element elementor-element-ccb4ffb elementor-section-height-min-height elementor-section-items-top elementor-section-boxed elementor-section-height-default elementor-section elementor-top-section

div.h4: With your financial support, we can close the digital divide that separates many of our students from the hardware and connectivity they need to continue their learning in the weeks ahead and support families and alumni in need.

section.class: elementor-element elementor-element-46309d5 elementor-section-boxed elementor-section-height-default elementor-section-height-default elementor-section elementor-top-section

div.class: elementor-element elementor-element-84c45af elementor-align-center animated-slow elementor-invisible elementor-widget elementor-widget-button

div.p: Graduates of IDEA Public Schools need financial support for transportation to their homes or a permanent location as dorms around the country are closing. This fund would also help provide basic necessities such as rent and food when campus jobs are lost and school cafeterias closed. Your support would also offer support with technology assistance to participate in online learning. All donations raised through this fund will go directly to IDEA alumni.

section.class: elementor-element elementor-element-361e939 elementor-section-boxed elementor-section-height-default elementor-section-height-default elementor-section elementor-top-section

div.h2: COVID-19 Students and Families Emergency Relief Fund

div.class: elementor-element elementor-element-4b3b33a elementor-align-center animated-slow elementor-invisible elementor-widget elementor-widget-button

div.p: Multiple IDEA families are losing their primary sources of income and are left without a way to pay for rent, electricity and other basic needs. At IDEA Public Schools, we are committed to the core value of team and family. All donations raised through this fund will go directly to IDEA families.

section.class: elementor-element elementor-element-4a29be0 elementor-section-boxed elementor-section-height-default elementor-section-height-default elementor-section elementor-top-section

div.class: elementor-element elementor-element-cd35fff elementor-align-center animated-slow elementor-invisible elementor-widget elementor-widget-button

b.span: Our goal is for all IDEA students in grades 1-12 to have access to a laptop computer connected to the internet in their home by

p.span: IDEA’s operations team conducted an extensive
,000 responses. Through this outreach, IDEA discovered that 7,720 IDEA households do not have internet access separate from a smartphone
and that most students did not have access to a laptop computer to complete assignments and connect with their teache
After redistributing 17,000 laptops from IDEA schools there are still nearly 26,0
n improved computer camera to increase
lesson detail for students and a speaker phone device to connect to laptops to improve teacher audio
All donations raised through this fund will support purchases of hardware and internet access for IDEA students

span.span: funding to support this effort, at this time these funds are not guaranteed
and may take considerable time to be allocated
to states and ultimately to students.
Our students need our help now.

section.class: elementor-element elementor-element-ef3f23f elementor-section-full_width elementor-section-height-default elementor-section-height-default elementor-section elementor-top-section
elementor-element elementor-element-5c0c852 elementor-section-boxed elementor-section-height-default elementor-section-height-default elementor-section elementor-top-section

div.p: IDEA PUBLIC SCHOOLS IS A TUITION FREE, PUBLIC CHARTER SCHOOL – OPEN TO ALL STUDENTS. Yet, even though we are a public school, IDEA receives less funding overall from state and local sources in comparison to traditional public schools, and only a small amount of funding for facilities.

div.div: SINCE OUR FOUNDING IN 2000, a number of federal grants, foundation grants, corporate gifts, and individual contributions have helped IDEA close this funding gap. We have put this money to good use – closing the opportunity gap for our students and propelling them to new heights of achievement.

section.class: elementor-element elementor-element-1f14fd7 elementor-section-boxed elementor-section-height-default elementor-section-height-default elementor-section elementor-top-section

elementor-element elementor-element-b229c27 elementor-section-height-min-height elementor-section-boxed elementor-section-height-default elementor-section-items-middle elementor-section elementor-top-section

div.h2: Your gift, of any amount, can help.

div.p: It will fund educational programs or bridge the college funding gap for our students. Your generosity can help our students matriculate to the college of their choice, not just the most affordable colleges, and go on to lead rewarding lives as productive members of their communities.

section.class: elementor-element elementor-element-1a48497 elementor-section-boxed elementor-section-height-default elementor-section-height-default elementor-section elementor-top-section

div.p: It is the policy of IDEA Public Schools not to discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex or handicap in its vocational programs, services or activities as required by Title VI of the Civil Rights Act of 1964, as amended; Title IX of the Education Amendments of 1972; and Section 504 of the Rehabilitation Act of 1973, as amended. As required by Texas Education Code 38.006 and 38.007, IDEA Public Schools maintains an alcohol-free and tobacco-free work environment.
Board Meetings & Agenda | Finance & Budget | Health Related Policies | CTE Non-Discrimination Statement | Annual Reporting

IDEA Public Schools National Board Members: Al Lopez – Chair, Xenia Garza – Chair-Elect, Ed Rivera – Treasurer, Ryan Vaughan – Secretary, Michael Burke, Preston Castille, Reba Cardenas McNair, David Earl, David Handley, Erich Holmsten, Bill Martin, Gabe Puente, Michael Rhodes, Victoria Rico, Saam Zarrabi, Collin Sewell
